page.title: 07ST.MARY'S WELL BAY
page.content: St.Mary's Well Bay is situated between Sully and Lavernock. It is an interesting place because it has a beach which is mostly sand and pebbles.The sea at low tide is a long way out,very shallow and muddy. Behind the beach are rocky cliffs which are very dangerous to climb or to sit under as rocks fall off. On the cliffs above St Mary's Well Bay is a nature reserve where many butterflies and a large number of rare flowers are to be found. On these cliffs it is also possible to see pill-boxes left over from the second world war. Also in St.Mary's Well Bay there is a club called "The Pirates' Roost" which is very popular with the tourists from the caravan sites which are at St.Mary's Well Bay.
